meanings.definition: The act of placing things side by side or next to each other.
meanings.sent1: In the art gallery, the appositions of the paintings created a beautiful display.
meanings.sent2: The appositions of the books on the shelf made it look neat and organized.
meanings.sent3: The appositions of the toys on the floor made it seem like a playful mess.
meanings.sent4: Her appositions of colorful flowers in the garden resembled a vibrant painting.
meanings.sent5: The appositions of the ingredients on the kitchen counter made it easy to start cooking.

meanings.definition: A grammatical construction in which two elements are placed side by side, with one element further describing the other.
meanings.sent1: The appositions of 'my friend' after 'Alice' clarified who I was talking about.
meanings.sent2: In the sentence 'The teacher, a kind woman, helped the students,' 'a kind woman' is an example of appositions.
meanings.sent3: The appositions of 'the sleepy cat' next to 'Garfield' in the story made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes, pools of wisdom, were an appositions that captivated all who met her.
meanings.sent5: The appositions of 'a loyal companion' after 'Max' highlighted his faithful nature.
